content: 1 friends blanket by maggie trunkhill daisy girl crochet 2 getting started overview do you ever spot crocheted blankets on tv shows one of my favorite tv shows is friends and ​ ​ they have a crocheted granny square blanket on the couch in monica and rachel s apartment the second picture on the page above since i always watch friends while i am crocheting i ​ ​ decided to recreate the blanket it is a variation of the typical granny square blanket to ensure that the squares have the x s on them i made mine with blue sky fibers worsted cotton yarn but any worsted weight yarn would work first make the fifty-four granny squares the granny squares are joined with the cream yarn using the join as you go method the blanket is bordered with a scalloped edge i hope you enjoy the pattern let me know if you have any questions if you make it and post it on instagram make sure you use the hashtag #crochetbydaisygirlcrochet and tag me so i can see it materials 5 5 mm crochet hook scissors and a darning needle- for weaving in loose ends blue sky fibers 100% organic cotton worsted yarn- 6 skeins of bone cream 2 raspberry berry 2 poppy orange 2 dandelion yellow and 2 thistle purple yarn substitution any worsted weight yarn will work for this project you will need 2 skeins of each color of the squares and 6 skeins of the cream to match the colors of the friends blanket i would ​ ​ recommend using raspberry dark purple yellow and orange yarn for the squares stitch abbreviations the pattern is written in u s terms but i have translated them to uk terms here if you prefer them stitch abbreviation stitch in u s terms translated to a uk term slip_stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain chain double_crochet double_crochet treble *note when i put stitches in that means that the stitches go into the same space stitches in means that they will be repeated later gauge and size gauge 12 stitches in 6 row= 4 inches or 3 rounds= 4 ¼ inch rather than focusing on gauge for this project i would recommend concentrating on the size of the granny squares each granny square should be about 5 5 by 5 5 inches 14 by 14 cm the finished size of the blanket is 60 5 inches by 41 inches or 154 cm by 104 cm when the cream border is added around each granny square they become 6 5 by 6 5 inches 16 5 by 16 5 cm and the scalloped edge around the blanket makes it larger 3 the granny squares make 14 berry 14 orange 13 yellow and 13 purple they should be about 5 5 by 5 5 inches foundation ring chain 4 slip_stitch into the first chain to form a ring ​ round 1 chain 3
